species.name: Human
species.description: Versatile and adaptable, humans are the baseline species found across the galaxy.

species.name: Engineer
species.description: Slim humanoids with a fragile physique and an innate talent for interfacing with machinery.

species.name: K'Erin
species.description: Proud and warlike aliens with a penchant for brutality and a peculiar sense of honor.

species.name: Soulless
species.description: A species of cybernetic organisms connected into a combined hive-intelligence.

species.name: Precursor
species.description: Graceful and refined alien humanoids who were traveling the stars when other species were still lingering in caves.

species.name: Feral
species.description: Humanoid-animal hybrids patterned on Earth predators, originally engineered for military purposes.

species.name: Swift
species.description: Diminutive, winged, lizard people known for their erratic, jerky motions.

species.name: De-converted
species.description: A prisoner of the Converted who began undergoing cyborg conversion before being rescued.

species.name: Unity Agent
species.description: A secret agent for the Unity administration, whether undercover or on the run.

species.name: Mysterious Past
species.description: A character who never talks about their origins, appearing as though they might not even know.

species.name: Hakshan
species.description: Friendly high-tech aliens traveling the galaxy in search of something.

species.name: Stalker
species.description: Blue-skinned Human gene-mods with an innate teleportation ability from a secret military project.

species.name: Manipulator
species.description: Bizarre-looking aliens renowned for talents at communication and political machination.

species.name: Feeler
species.description: Members of cultures possessing extremely strong emotional output.

species.name: Empath
species.description: A character with a minor psionic inclination useful during negotiations.

species.name: Primitive
species.description: Inhabitants from a technologically regressed world who find it difficult to shed their backwards ways.

species.name: Genetic Uplift
species.description: Super-humans created via expensive genetic adjustments to the basic Human template.

species.name: Hulker
species.description: Bulging with muscles and rage, these gene-mods are perfect for hauling, crushing, and breaking.

species.name: Hopeful Rookie
species.description: Wide-eyed and enthusiastic beginners entering a harsh universe.

species.name: Mutant
species.description: Genetic distorts common around the galaxy due to weaponry, experiments, or pollution.

species.name: Assault Bot
species.description: A work Bot encased in armor and programmed with a homicidal demeanor.

species.name: Emo-suppressed
species.description: A character unable to feel any emotions beyond those needed for rudimentary existence.

species.name: Minor Alien
species.description: One of the many alien species that do not form a major political entity in the Fringe.

species.name: Traveler
species.description: An odd person claiming they are not really from this moment in space and time.

species.name: Bio-upgrade
species.description: Humans given genetic treatments to take full advantage of multiple cybernetic enhancements.

species.name: Standard Bot
species.description: Typical Bot configurations that fit most general purpose simulations.

backgrounds.name: Peaceful, High-Tech Colony
backgrounds.description: Not the most exciting origins but plenty of people born into a relatively comfortable existence decide to seek adventure elsewhere.

backgrounds.name: Giant, Overcrowded, Dystopian City
backgrounds.description: Years of breathing recycled air, eating algae-based slob and dealing with gangs, psychos and 99.7% unemployment makes a gun battle on the Fringe look like a nice afternoon.

backgrounds.name: Low-Tech Colony
backgrounds.description: It's common for colonies to revert to lower levels of technology than their parent world, since simple, sustainable technologies that can be easily reproduced improves survival chances.

backgrounds.name: Mining Colony
backgrounds.description: Worlds rich in minerals or other resources but too expensive to terraform tend to become mining colonies. Brutish life under brutish conditions.

backgrounds.name: Military Brat
backgrounds.description: Your family all served in the military and expectations were high for you as well.

backgrounds.name: Space Station
backgrounds.description: The largest Unity stations are floating city states in themselves. You got used to cramped conditions, seeing interesting people and occasional explosive decompression.

backgrounds.name: Military Outpost
backgrounds.description: While Unity Core space is quite peaceful, the borders of reclaimed territory tend to be prone to military aggression.

backgrounds.name: Drifter
backgrounds.description: Never quite fitting in, never quite settling down, you spent your youth trying to make do as well as you could, wherever you ended up.

backgrounds.name: Lower Megacity Class
backgrounds.description: A city of billions, the lower class conditions are stable if incredibly dull, repetitive and uninspiring.

backgrounds.name: Wealthy Merchant Family
backgrounds.description: Commerce makes everything go around and your family has done very well indeed. So why are you out here?

backgrounds.name: Frontier Gang
backgrounds.description: The frontiers are tough and often rife with madmen and dangerous lifeforms. Some gangs are opportunistic thugs, others act as local police forces.

backgrounds.name: Religious Cult
backgrounds.description: The only two things that are considered beyond counting by Unity Bureaucracy are people and religions. They do so with fervour.

backgrounds.name: War-Torn Hell-Hole
backgrounds.description: Growing up in the trenches was not exactly a happy childhood but it seemed natural to you.

backgrounds.name: Tech Guild
backgrounds.description: Modern technology is incredibly complex and several guilds have formed to further the exploration of specific forms of science.

backgrounds.name: Subjugated Colony on Alien World
backgrounds.description: While some aliens will do horrible things to their new subjects, in most cases, some sort of liveable agreement occurs.

backgrounds.name: Long-Term Space Mission
backgrounds.description: The galaxy is large and at any time there's scores of exploration fleets. Many of these are generation ships.

backgrounds.name: Research Outpost
backgrounds.description: Larger research outposts require a significant amount of manual labour and day to day maintenance.

backgrounds.name: Primitive or Regressed World
backgrounds.description: When cut off from main stream trade and contact, worlds will eventually settle on a level of technology they can sustain themselves.

backgrounds.name: Orphan Utility Program
backgrounds.description: The UOUP exists to ensure that every citizen finds something constructive to do with themselves.

backgrounds.name: Isolationist Enclave
backgrounds.description: Unity worlds are littered with occasionally sizeable enclaves that prefer to keep the rest of the galaxy at arms length.

backgrounds.name: Comfortable Megacity Class
backgrounds.description: You had a quiet job, fiddling with databases, and even breathing fresh air on every other Friday.

backgrounds.name: Industrial World
backgrounds.description: Many worlds are dominated by industry. It tends to breed resourceful, tough people.

backgrounds.name: Bureaucrat
backgrounds.description: The Bureaucracy runs everything. It numbers in the billions and is involved with every possible aspect of life in Unity.

backgrounds.name: Wasteland Nomads
backgrounds.description: On hard, dangerous worlds, most colonists perish. A few however prosper and 'go native'.

backgrounds.name: Alien Culture
backgrounds.description: Whether a colony that seceded or a group that migrated, you grew up in a non-human culture, adopting its values and customs as your own.

motivations.name: Wealth
motivations.description: Get rich, strike it big and retire somewhere that serves food you can recognize.

motivations.name: Fame
motivations.description: Whatever your cause, you want to be known as the one behind it.

motivations.name: Glory
motivations.description: Defeat the strongest fighter, immortality lies in great battle deeds.

motivations.name: Survival
motivations.description: Being alive beats the alternatives and you intend to keep it that way.

motivations.name: Escape
motivations.description: Big, unpleasant people with big, unpleasant guns are after you. Life isn't so bad on the fringe.

motivations.name: Adventure
motivations.description: New places to see! Aliens, strange technology and strange worlds under stranger suns. You live for this stuff.

motivations.name: Truth
motivations.description: Your entire life has been shrouded in lies. Now you are starting to realize that something is wrong, and you're determined to get to the bottom of it.

motivations.name: Technology
motivations.description: Fantastic artefacts and alien tech is what you crave. Whether from scientific curiosity, a desire to build a doomsday device or to advance human knowledge, you can't resist a shiny gadget.

motivations.name: Discovery
motivations.description: The idea that there is uncharted space seems like a wrong that must be corrected.

motivations.name: Loyalty
motivations.description: You don't care too much where you are going or why you are there, as long as your crew knows they can depend on you. You've pulled each other out of the fire plenty of times.

motivations.name: Revenge
motivations.description: Someone did you wrong and you intend to set things right. Whether a single person or a massive organization, you are driven towards that end.

motivations.name: Romance
motivations.description: They say that on a thousand worlds in the Fringe, everyone eventually finds someone who will put up with them for the rest of their lives. You don't want that though. You want the perfect one.

motivations.name: Faith
motivations.description: You've seen that there's more to the universe than physical existence and it keeps you going in the darkest of times.

motivations.name: Political
motivations.description: Unlike most, you have a coherent view of what the world should look like and the optimal way things should be organized. If only people would stop and listen.

motivations.name: Power
motivations.description: You dream of one day being on top, legions at your beck and call. The Fringes have broken as many as it has elevated. Which will you be?

motivations.name: Order
motivations.description: Disorder and anarchy upset you. Only under a semblance of order can civilization truly prosper.

motivations.name: Freedom
motivations.description: You may not be an anarchist but you value freedom above all else. The Fringes represent the last true free space and you want to keep it that way.

characterClasses.name: Working Class
characterClasses.description: There’s a million dirty, menial jobs that need doing and a million employers paying terrible wages for them. No particular skill set.

characterClasses.name: Technician
characterClasses.description: A piece of equipment in perfect condition is a rare sight and people with a knack for fixing things tend to be a valuable addition to any team.

characterClasses.name: Scientist
characterClasses.description: Some pursue science because they feel a calling to discover the world. Others want to build killer robots.

characterClasses.name: Hacker
characterClasses.description: The lack of stream lined, planet wide computer systems means that "Hacker" tends to imply any talent for intrusion, not just computer based ones.

characterClasses.name: Soldier
characterClasses.description: "Professional Military" on the Fringes can mean anything from Unity troops to local goons with (mostly) the same colour helmets.

characterClasses.name: Mercenary
characterClasses.description: The Fringes are rich in opportunities for people who don't mind supplying violence for money.

characterClasses.name: Agitator
characterClasses.description: Outside the reaches of Unity's stifling social engineering, there's a million causes and a billion spokes people for said causes.

characterClasses.name: Primitive
characterClasses.description: For whatever reason you’ve rejected technology or just never got the hang of it.

characterClasses.name: Artist
characterClasses.description: Life on the Fringes isn’t all violence and explosions. Sometimes it’s paintings of violence and explosions.

characterClasses.name: Negotiator
characterClasses.description: The Negotiator is usually employed by someone else to make their points. Some are just charismatic leader types.

characterClasses.name: Trader
characterClasses.description: The erratic flow of any good imaginable is either an economists dream or nightmare.

characterClasses.name: Starship Crew
characterClasses.description: Star ships are pretty complex machines and require a variety of specialized crew to operate.

characterClasses.name: Petty Criminal
characterClasses.description: In polite company, you say you work in "Localized Trade Item Acquisitions".

characterClasses.name: Ganger
characterClasses.description: Depending on the world, gangs may be the local law, a criminal racket or a matter of survival.

characterClasses.name: Scoundrel
characterClasses.description: Generic star port scum. Your parents are probably disappointed. If you had marketable skills, you would be something different.

characterClasses.name: Enforcer
characterClasses.description: The Law requires representatives and most of them tend to be pretty no-nonsense about how they do the representing.

characterClasses.name: Special Agent
characterClasses.description: Countless agents prowl the Fringes trying to subtly enforce the will of their superiors. (Replaced Unity Agent)

characterClasses.name: Troubleshooter
characterClasses.description: When people need a problem solved, they call you. The problem is usually not a smoking crater until after you are done.

characterClasses.name: Bounty Hunter
characterClasses.description: Whether you work for the Law or take private jobs, you've made a living out of acquiring those others will pay for.

characterClasses.name: Nomad
characterClasses.description: Travel the frontier, see new worlds and eat strange food. (Replaces Traveller)

characterClasses.name: Explorer
characterClasses.description: Reclaiming is the long process of integrating a world. Explorer agents are crafty and innovative. (Replaces Reclaimer)

characterClasses.name: Punk
characterClasses.description: Strange hair colours, loud music and a foul demeanour. No measurable skills but plenty of attitude.

characterClasses.name: Scavenger
characterClasses.description: You have a unique knack for finding uses of discarded garbage.

gear.name: Assault Blade
gear.description: Standard assault blade for close quarters.

gear.name: Concealed Blade
gear.description: Hidden melee weapon for emergency use.

gear.name: Loaded Dice
gear.description: Item used to manipulate games of chance.

gear.name: Purifier
gear.description: Device for cleaning contaminated air or water.

gear.name: Steel Boots
gear.description: Reinforced footwear for protection and brawling.

gadgets.name: AI Companion
gadgets.description: Portable artificial intelligence for technical support.

gadgets.name: Analyzer
gadgets.description: Device for examining unknown materials and tech.

gadgets.name: Battle Visor
gadgets.description: Heads-up display for combat tactical data.

gadgets.name: Boosted Arm
gadgets.description: Cybernetic or mechanical arm enhancement.

gadgets.name: Boosted Leg
gadgets.description: Cybernetic or mechanical leg enhancement.

gadgets.name: Cyber Hand
gadgets.description: High-dexterity cybernetic hand replacement.

gadgets.name: Displacer
gadgets.description: Device used to shift physical position or appearance.

gadgets.name: Distraction Bot
gadgets.description: Deployable unit designed to draw enemy fire.

gadgets.name: Duplicator
gadgets.description: Advanced tech for copying signatures or data.

gadgets.name: Insta-Wall
gadgets.description: Rapid-deployable temporary defensive cover.

gadgets.name: Jump Belt
gadgets.description: Short-burst personal flight or leap enhancer.

gadgets.name: Nerve Adjuster
gadgets.description: Neurological implant to suppress fear or pain.

gadgets.name: Repair Bot
gadgets.description: Autonomous unit for fixing mechanical casualties.

gadgets.name: Scanner Bot
gadgets.description: Enhanced autonomous reconnaissance unit.

gadgets.name: Screen Generator
gadgets.description: Personal energy shield projection.

gadgets.name: Seeker Sight
gadgets.description: Advanced targeting that identifies weak points.

gadgets.name: Shock Attachment
gadgets.description: Weapon upgrade for electrical discharge.

gadgets.name: Snooper Bot
gadgets.description: Small, stealthy drone for surveillance.

gadgets.name: Sonic Emitter
gadgets.description: Acoustic device for disorienting enemies.

gadgets.name: Stabilizer
gadgets.description: Device for recoil management and precision.

gadgets.name: Stealth Gear
gadgets.description: Specialized equipment for avoiding detection.

gadgets.name: Stim-pack
gadgets.description: High-intensity chemical combat stimulant.

weaponTraits.name: Area
weaponTraits.description: Resolve all shots against the initial target. They cannot be spread. Then resolve one bonus shot against every figure within 2".

weaponTraits.name: Clumsy
weaponTraits.description: -1 to Brawling rolls, if opponent has higher Speed.

weaponTraits.name: Critical
weaponTraits.description: A natural 6 on the Hit roll will inflict 2 Hits on the target.

weaponTraits.name: Elegant
weaponTraits.description: When Brawling, the fighter may reroll the die. Enemies will always reroll if they have a lower total than their opponent, and can improve the result.

weaponTraits.name: Focused
weaponTraits.description: All shots must be against a single target.

weaponTraits.name: Heavy
weaponTraits.description: -1 penalty to Hit if the firer moved this round.

weaponTraits.name: Impact
weaponTraits.description: If target is Stunned, place a second Stun marker.

weaponTraits.name: Single use
weaponTraits.description: The item can be used only once and must be deducted from the available supply. The Panic Fire rule (p.46) cannot be used with Single use weapons.

weaponTraits.name: Stun
weaponTraits.description: All targets are automatically Stunned. No damage rolls takes place.

weaponTraits.name: Terrifying
weaponTraits.description: Any target hit must retreat 1D6" away from the firer.

weapons.name: Auto rifle
weapons.description: A heavy rifle fitted with an ammo drum, and used for medium-range fire support.

weapons.name: Beam pistol
weapons.description: Military-grade heavy-energy pistol with a tightly focused beam.

weapons.name: Blade
weapons.description: Sturdy, light-weight fencing or slashing blade, favored for boarding actions.

weapons.name: Blast pistol
weapons.description: Projects a bolt of searing energy which detonates on impact. Dissipation is rapid, giving the weapon limited range.

weapons.name: Blast rifle
weapons.description: Rifle or carbine energy bolt weapon. Signifies that the user means business.

weapons.name: Boarding saber
weapons.description: A heavy but carefully balanced sword. Often fitted with hand guards.

weapons.name: Brutal melee weapon
weapons.description: A heavy, unpleasant-looking weapon for smashing and breaking things... or people.

weapons.name: Cling fire pistol
weapons.description: Side arm firing a spray of sticky, burning chemicals.

weapons.name: Colony rifle
weapons.description: Standard-type defensive rifle, popular with colonists and frontier folk. Simple to maintain. Typically semi-automatic.

weapons.name: Dazzle grenade
weapons.description: Shock charge emitting a loud flash and deafening sound.

weapons.name: Duelling pistol
weapons.description: Custom-made pistol built for careful aiming. Popular with the fabulously wealthy or old-fashioned.

weapons.name: Flak gun
weapons.description: Powerful military shotgun, designed for boarding operations and bug hunts in close quarters.

weapons.name: Frakk grenade
weapons.description: Explosive charge surrounded by a metal casing. Often improvised.

weapons.name: Fury rifle
weapons.description: High-powered beam weapon modified from military anti-tank designs. Slow build-up before discharge.

weapons.name: Glare sword
weapons.description: Elegant fencing weapon. The blade is encased in a disruptive energy field, allowing it to cut with great precision.

weapons.name: Hand cannon
weapons.description: Heavy pistol in a massive caliber. Appreciated by bug hunters.

weapons.name: Hand flamer
weapons.description: Portable flame-throwing device with a broad focus for area effect.

weapons.name: Hand laser
weapons.description: Portable energy-based pistol. Popular due to ease of use and lack of recoil.

weapons.name: Hand gun
weapons.description: Conventional semi-automatic pistol in a medium caliber.

weapons.name: Hold out pistol
weapons.description: Compact pocket-pistol for personal defense.

weapons.name: Hunting rifle
weapons.description: Typical high-caliber rifle, used for hunting large, dangerous animals.

weapons.name: Hyper blaster
weapons.description: Rapid-fire blast weapon. Most models rely on three rotating barrels to deal with heat build-up.

weapons.name: Infantry laser
weapons.description: Military energy rifle with detachable battery pack.

weapons.name: Machine pistol
weapons.description: A compact, fully automatic firearm in pistol caliber.

weapons.name: Marksman's rifle
weapons.description: Military rifle, built for sharp shooting. Common platoon-level support weapon.

weapons.name: Military rifle
weapons.description: Conventional military automatic rifle. Caseless ammunition is typical.

weapons.name: Needle rifle
weapons.description: Uses magnetism to launch a hail of razor-sharp needles at a target.

weapons.name: Plasma rifle
weapons.description: Heavy rifle firing a stream of blue-white energy bolts. Excellent all-round combat weapon, but expensive and difficult to cool.

weapons.name: Power claw
weapons.description: Heavy servo-boosted gauntlet that straps to the entire arm. Capable of punching through steel.

weapons.name: Rattle gun
weapons.description: Conventional machine gun. Fringe models are outdated and somewhat kit-bashed. Typically belt-fed.

weapons.name: Ripper sword
weapons.description: Short, chopping blade fitted with microscopic "teeth" for ripping and tearing. Popular with K'Erin marines.

weapons.name: Scrap pistol
weapons.description: A pistol pieced together from scavenged parts. Common on the frontiers.

weapons.name: Shatter axe
weapons.description: This bulky weapon discharges a blast of energy as it strikes. Originally intended for breach-and-clear operations.

weapons.name: Shell gun
weapons.description: Stand-alone grenade launcher. Many of these are custom-built.

weapons.name: Shotgun
weapons.description: Smooth-bore weapon firing a hail of pellets. Common hunting and defensive weapon.

weapons.name: Suppression maul
weapons.description: Riot-control weapon that overloads pain receptors in most biological lifeforms.

shipTypes.name: Strange alien vessel
shipTypes.description: A mysterious craft of unknown origin.

shipTypes.name: Repurposed science vessel
shipTypes.description: Scientific ship converted for frontier use.

shipTypes.name: Battered mining ship
shipTypes.description: Sturdy but considered a Fuel Hog.

shipTypes.name: Unreliable merchant cruiser
shipTypes.description: Large merchant ship with some mechanical quirks.

shipTypes.name: Former diplomatic vessel
shipTypes.description: Sleek ship used for previous negotiations.

shipTypes.name: Worn colony ship
shipTypes.description: Standard Issue vessel used for colonization.

weMetThrough.name: Hired by a random member of the group
Pursuit of random group member's motivation
Being in trouble with the authorities
A random meeting in a bar
Mutual protection in a hostile universe

gadgets.name: AI Companion
gadgets.description: Portable artificial intelligence for technical support.

weapons.name: Shotgun
weapons.description: Reliable low tech scatter weapon.

weapons.name: Colony Rifle
weapons.description: Standard issue long arm for colonists.

weapons.name: Handgun
weapons.description: Standard low tech pistol.

weapons.name: Rattle Gun
weapons.description: Heavy rate of fire military weapon.

weapons.name: Military Rifle
weapons.description: Standard issue military grade rifle.

weapons.name: Military Rifle
weapons.description: Standard issue military grade rifle.

weapons.name: Hand Laser
weapons.description: Standard high tech laser pistol.

ship.name: ok
ship.description: Scientific ship converted for frontier use.

campaignCrews.name: 4 members - only humans.... Crew

gear.name: Assault Blade
gear.description: Standard assault blade for close quarters.

gadgets.name: Snooper Bot
gadgets.description: Small, stealthy drone for surveillance.

weapons.name: Machine pistol
weapons.description: A compact, fully automatic firearm in pistol caliber.

weapons.name: Hand gun
weapons.description: Conventional semi-automatic pistol in a medium caliber.

weapons.name: Shotgun
weapons.description: Smooth-bore weapon firing a hail of pellets. Common hunting and defensive weapon.

weapons.name: Shell gun
weapons.description: Stand-alone grenade launcher. Many of these are custom-built.

weapons.name: Rattle gun
weapons.description: Conventional machine gun. Fringe models are outdated and somewhat kit-bashed. Typically belt-fed.

weapons.name: Marksman's rifle
weapons.description: Military rifle, built for sharp shooting. Common platoon-level support weapon.

weapons.name: Cling fire pistol
weapons.description: Side arm firing a spray of sticky, burning chemicals.

campaignCrews.weMetThrough: Hired by a random member of the group

campaignCards.name: It's time to go!
campaignCards.description: The crew may immediately end a battle, with all remaining characters escaping from the fight.

campaignCards.name: Looked worse than it was!
campaignCards.description: Ignore a roll on the Injury Table. The character recovers immediately.

campaignCards.name: Did you ever meet my mate?
campaignCards.description: Add a new character to your team immediately, even mid-battle. Place the model within 6" of any battlefield edge. They can act immediately.

campaignCards.name: Lucky shot!
campaignCards.description: If a character just missed a shot, turn it into a hit. Only applies to a single shot, even if the weapon rolls multiple attack dice.

campaignCards.name: Rainy day fund!
campaignCards.description: Immediately add 1D6+5 credits to your available funds.
